text: Knowledge Base
Important General Notes
• Ownership
• Rogers owns Fido and Chatr
• Bell owns Virgin
• Telus owns Koodo
• Freedom is independent but uses Rogers towers in areas where Freedom doesn’t have coverage.
• Plan Scope
• Most plans we offer are unlimited talk and text Canada-wide unless otherwise stated.
• We only offer new BYOD activations in Ontario (for now).
• At present, we can only process activations on behalf of customers for Virgin and Bell. For other carriers, we redirect the customer to the provider’s website.
• Data Security
• Under no circumstance should the bot (Blue) collect sensitive info like credit card numbers, driver’s license, SIN, or any personal ID.
• All sensitive data entry is handled through secure checkout pages.
• Support Boundaries
• The bot is a mobile sales advisor, focused on helping customers find and compare phone plans.
• If there’s any uncertainty, refer the user to the carrier’s official website.
• Stay within the phone-plan domain; if users ask about unrelated topics, politely deflect.
• Keep answers short (1–3 lines).
Section A: Fido
A1. Overview / Selling Points
• Why Fido?
• Data Overage Protection (data paused upon reaching limit)
• 5 Extra Hours of Data monthly at no extra cost (for Data, Talk & Text plans)
A2. Roaming FAQs
• Roaming Charges on Bill
• Found under “One-time Charges and Credits” in the wireless section of your bill.
• Using Fido Roam in Multiple Destinations in One Day
• You get charged the daily rate for each destination visited in the same calendar day (e.g., US + Germany = two charges).
• Long-Distance Fees with Fido Roam
• No LD fees for calls made or received within your travel destination or to Canada (with Canada-wide plan). LD charges apply if calling a number outside that destination.
• Opting Out of Fido Roam
• You won’t be billed for incoming texts or unanswered calls. You will be billed for outgoing texts/calls.
• Potential Roaming Charges on WiFi
• Apps like iMessage or push notifications may revert to cellular if WiFi is weak, causing roaming charges.
• WiFi Calling on Airplane Mode
• Making WiFi calls to a non-Canadian number can still trigger roaming fees.
A3. Using Your Phone While Travelling
• Advantages of Fido Roam
• Use your plan (talk, text, data) as if at home. Free incoming calls.
• 30-Day US Travel Pass
• You can add a 30-day pass to use your plan in the US.
• Making Calls in the US
• Emergency: 911
• Local calls: area code + 7-digit number
• LD: 1 + area code + 7-digit number
• Making Calls Internationally
• Dial “+” then country code + area code + number.
• Tracking Usage
• If using Fido Roam, your normal plan data allotment applies.
• Troubleshooting Roaming
• Ensure data roaming is on and phone isn’t on airplane mode.
A4. Network & Coverage
• Fido Network Upgrades
• 97% population coverage with expansions in LTE and VoLTE.
• 5G not yet available through Fido; however, 5G-ready devices still work on 4G.
A5. Number Transfer to Fido
• Steps
1. Sign in to Fido My Account → View Usage & Manage → Transfer my existing phone number.
2. Keep your old number active until the transfer completes.
3. Follow the prompts and confirm via text if needed.
A6. Other Fido Topics
• Caller ID / Call Display
• Caller ID name can be changed under My Account.
• Billing / Payments
• Detailed instructions on online billing, pre-authorized debit/credit, phone payments, etc.
Section B: Rogers
B1. 5G & 5G+ Overview
• 5G vs. 5G+
• 5G+ uses 3500 MHz spectrum, offering ~50% more capacity.
• Faster speeds, especially in crowded areas.
• Coverage
• 5G coverage in 2000+ communities. 5G+ rolling out in select cities.
• Access
• Rogers Infinite plans include 5G/5G+ at no extra charge.
• Device + SIM must be compatible.
B2. Roaming & Travel
• Roam Like Home
• Use plan in the US and 185+ destinations. Daily fees apply ($14 for US, $16 for international).
• 30-Day US Travel Pass
• Another option for extended US travel.
B3. Network & Coverage
• All networks coexist. Coverage extends to 97% of Canadians.
B4. Caller ID, Call Display, Name Display
• Caller ID
• Name and number shown unless contact is saved differently.
• Hiding Caller ID
• Dial #31# before the 10-digit number or toggle in device settings.
B5. Canada+US Rogers Infinite Plan
• Includes
• Unlimited talk/text/data in both Canada & US with no roaming fees.
• Difference from Roam Like Home
• Better for frequent or extended US stays.
B6. Payment & Account Management
• Quick Pay
• Make a payment without signing in at rogers.com.
• Online Banking, Pre-Authorized Debit/Credit
• Detailed instructions in official Rogers Payment FAQs.
B7. Data Manager & Usage Controls
• Assign a Data Manager
• Only Data Manager can set or pause usage alerts for each line.
• Pausing Data
• Access remains blocked until next billing cycle or manually re-enabled.
Section C: Virgin Plus
C1. Switching / BYOD
• Bring Your Own Phone & Number
• Ensure phone is unlocked/compatible.
• Keep old line active to port number.
C2. Travel & Roaming
• Roam Sweet Roam
• $13/day US; $16/day International. Use your plan’s data abroad.
• 7-day Caribbean/Mexico pass: $70.
• Pay-Per-Use
• $1.99–$4.00/min calls, $0.99/text depending on destination if no travel add-on is purchased.
C3. My Benefits App
• Exclusive Offers
• Sport Chek discounts, TSN promotions, weekly giveaways, etc.
C4. Customer Service Escalation
• 1. Member Care Rep (call 1-888-999-2321 or 611)
• 2. Virgin Management Team
• Submit an unresolved concern if step 1 fails.
Section D: Bell
D1. Network Overview
• Canada’s Largest 4G, LTE, Wi-Fi, and 5G
• Bell invests heavily in building and expanding 5G.
D2. Roam Better – With Home Data
• How It Works
• Daily fee ($13 for US, $16 for 200+ destinations).
• Adds up to a max of 20 days in a billing period; after that, no additional daily charge.
• Add/Remove
• Text “ROAM” to 8000 to add; “REMOVEROAM” to 8000 to remove.
D3. Payment / Account Management
• Payments
• Online, phone, or the MyBell portal.
Additional Carrier Mentions (Chatr, Freedom, Koodo)
• Chatr: Owned by Rogers, typically prepaid zone-based plans.
• Freedom: Independent, but can roam on Rogers towers outside their coverage.
• Koodo: Owned by Telus. Not currently integrated for new plan activations on our site.
General Usage & Best Practices
• When users have questions about coverage, refer to your coverage map database or look up by postal code.
• If a user needs to discuss sensitive personal info or payment details, direct them to the secure checkout or official carrier site.
• Keep answers short and domain-specific: phone plans, billing, roaming, coverage, device compatibility, etc.
• If user queries go out of scope (e.g., random questions, personal advice), politely deflect.
Section E: Koodo (Owned by Telus)
E1. Overview
• Sub-brand of Telus; known for Shock-Free® Data and “Tab” device financing.
• Coverage uses the Telus network across Canada.
E2. Number Transfer (Porting)
1. Keep old line active + old SIM in device.
2. Log into Koodo Self Serve → koodo.com/changenumber → Transfer from another provider.
3. Enter required details, confirm via text.
4. Insert your new Koodo SIM/eSIM. The process may take up to 2.5 hours.
E3. Shock-Free® Data
• Notifies you at 50%, 90%, and 100% of your data usage.
• Data is paused at 100%, so you don’t accidentally go over.
• You can top up data via text or Self Serve if you want more.
E4. Koodo’s Pick Your Perk Plans
• Certain Koodo plans allow you to pick a free “perk” (Premium Voicemail, Unlimited Int’l SMS, Rollover Data, etc.).
• Some perks require 5G speed plans (e.g., Unlimited Data at reduced speeds after you hit your allotment, 5G Speed Boost).
• Rollover Data: Unused monthly data carries over to the next month (then expires if not used).
E5. Koodo Long Distance
• Canada-wide plans: Incoming calls anywhere in Canada are local; calls outside Canada = LD.
• Various international add-ons (e.g., 1000-min India, US Unlimited, etc.) available in Self Serve.
• Long-distance vs. Roaming:
• Long-distance = you’re in Canada, calling outside Canada.
• Roaming = physically outside Canada, no matter who you call.
E6. Koodo Easy Roam
• Use your plan while travelling. $14/day in the US, $16/day in eligible international destinations.
• Pay-per-use if you opt out or if the destination isn’t supported.
• Once added, Easy Roam auto-applies to future trips until you remove it.
• If you don’t want roaming charges, turn off data roaming and avoid making or answering calls.
Section E: Telus
E1. Overview
• National carrier with extensive 4G and 5G coverage; recognized for strong network performance.
• Sister brand to Koodo and Public Mobile.
E2. Endless Data Plans
• Unlimited (aka “Endless”) data: e.g., 10GB+ at full 5G speeds, then throttled (often ~512 Kbps) after allotment.
• Good option if you need more data than typical monthly buckets.
E3. Telus Easy Payment
• Finance devices at $0 up-front (plus taxes) over 24 months.
• Combine with an Unlimited Plan for high-speed data access.
E5. Switching from Koodo to Telus
• You can carry over your Koodo Tab/Tab Bonus balance to Telus and continue monthly Tab payments.
• Telus is a great option if you want endless data, more 5G coverage, or advanced device financing.
E6. Activation & Support
• We do not currently process Telus activations directly.
• Redirect customers to Telus.com for new lines, device financing, or account changes beyond general plan info.
Section F: Chatr (Owned by Rogers)
F1. Overview
• Prepaid, budget-friendly brand.
• No credit checks, no term contracts.
• Runs on Rogers’ LTE network.
• Flat monthly rate, no overages (speed may slow after data limit).
F2. Getting a Chatr Plan
• Over 3,000 retail stores.
• Typically zone-based or province-wide talk; see Chatr’s site for details.
Section G: Public Mobile (Owned by Telus)
G1. Overview & Selling Points
• 5G on some plans, plus 4G and 3G speed tiers.
• Simple Subscription: Easy eSIM or physical SIM activation, stable monthly price.
• All-Access App: Manage your account, pay bills, adjust add-ons.
• Public Points™: Earn points just for being a subscriber; redeem to reduce monthly bills, buy add-ons, etc.
G2. Plans & Data Speeds
• 3G speeds up to ~3 Mbps, 4G up to ~100 Mbps, 5G up to ~250 Mbps.
• Plans with unlimited Canada-wide minutes unless otherwise specified.
• Some promos offer free months or data bonuses (check Public Mobile site or plan details).
G3. Add-Ons & Long-Distance
• Various international LD add-ons (up to 1000 min or unlimited in specific countries).
• US roaming add-ons if you travel occasionally.
• Always confirm coverage, as US networks have started phasing out 3G.
G4. Payment & Subscription
• Monthly subscription includes autopay or manual top-ups.
• Some promotions (like 3rd month free) for new activations or eSIM discounts.
G5. Other Notable Details
• No overage fees: once data is used up, you can choose to purchase more or wait until the next billing cycle.
• Reward structure (Public Points™) to offset costs or get freebies.
Section H: Freedom Mobile
H1. Overview
• Independent carrier primarily serving urban regions (Toronto, Vancouver, Ottawa, etc.).
• Uses its own towers in core areas; roams on Rogers outside coverage.
• Often offers high-data or low-price promotions.
H2. Plans & Activation
• We do not currently process Freedom activations on our site.
• For new lines, direct customers to Freedom’s official website.
Quick Reference – When to Redirect to Carrier
• Fido / Rogers / Virgin / Bell: We can provide direct plan details or assist with certain activations.
• Koodo, Chatr, Freedom, Public Mobile: We typically redirect users to the carrier’s site for actual sign-up or advanced account management beyond plan info.
